block.p: Deborah Alyse Brown, the daughter of Gloria Brown and Dr. Ashley Brown of Rockville, Md., was married yesterday to Jefrey Ian Pollock, the son of Joy and Jay Pollock of Huntingdon Valley, Pa. Rabbi Tamara Miller officiated at the Daughters of the American Revolution Genealogical Library in Washington.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 29, graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, she magna cum laude, he cum laude. They also attended Columbia, from which the bride received law and Master of Social Work degrees and the bridegroom a Master of Public Administration degree.

Deborah Alyse Brown, the daughter of Gloria Brown and Dr. Ashley Brown of Rockville, Md., was married yesterday to Jefrey Ian Pollock, the son of Joy and Jay Pollock of Huntingdon Valley, Pa. Rabbi Tamara Miller officiated at the Daughters of the American Revolution Genealogical Library in Washington.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 29, graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, she magna cum laude, he cum laude. They also attended Columbia, from which the bride received law and Master of Social Work degrees and the bridegroom a Master of Public Administration degree.

Ms. Brown, who is keeping her name, is an associate in the Washington office of Latham & Watkins, the Los Angeles law firm. Her father, who is retired, was a director of research in chemical toxicology at the Food and Drug Administration in Rockville. Her mother is a dental hygienist in Rockville.

Mr. Pollock is an owner of the Global Strategy Group, a political and market research company in New York. He is also an adjunct instructor in public policy at Columbia. His mother is the national chairwoman of corporate and foundation relations at Hadassah, the Jewish women's organization in New York. His father, a pharmacist, owns Suburban Pharmacy in Philadelphia.
